properties.Name: Access (Aboriginal Community Career Employment Services Society)
properties.Description: Provides skills and employment training programs for Aboriginal people.

properties.Name: Aunt Leah's Place
properties.Description: Aunt Leah's Place has two employment programs: Bootstraps (skills development and job placements for youth from foster care) and Retail Training (a five week program learning how to navigate the retail industry)

properties.Name: Community Living Society
properties.Description: Has several employment programs for persons with developmental disabilities or brain injuries, including employment services, potteryworks, and studio73

properties.Name: Douglas College
properties.Description: Has a several programs, including a Self Employment Program (offers practical training, business advice and group support to help people develop the skills and knowledge needed to start and operate a successful business) and an Essential Skills program (helps people facing multiple barriers in developing the foundation skills they need to achieve their career goals).

properties.Name: Elizabeth Fry Society - Pat Ware Fund and Woolwerx
properties.Description: Pat Ware Fund: This fund helps prepare women for employment by paying for training or necessary equipment. Woolwerx: Woolwerx is EFryâ€™s social enterprise that employs both incarcerated women and those transitioning back to community life. Women receive training to clean, card and spin donated wool into artisanal yarns.

properties.Name: Fraser Works New Westminster Employment Service Centre
properties.Description: Employment support and referral through a case management approach. Fraserworks is a partnership between four agencies: Fraserside Community Services, Pacific Community Resources Society, AWARE Society and MOSAIC.

properties.Name: Immigrant Services Society of BC
properties.Description: Provides employment services for immigrants, including Jobquest program

properties.Name: Inclusion BC - Ready, Willing & Able
properties.Description: Helps link persons with intellectual disabilities and Autism with job opportunities.

properties.Name: New Westminster Homelessness Coalition Society - I's on the Street
properties.Description: Engages homeless and at risk of homeless persons in supervised employment cleaning and tidying the sidewalks/streets in front of local businesses. Also can connect homeless or at risk of homeless persons with employment and job training.

properties.Name: PosAbilities - Employment Services
properties.Description: PosAbilities provides employment training and counselling services for individuals with developmental disabilities. PosAbilities also matches up these individuals and their needs with the needs of employers

properties.Name: Aware Society - Job Options BC
properties.Description: Job Options BC is a 10 week program designed to improve skills and obtain employment.
